description:
Otonashi wakes up in the afterlife to find out he has no memories of his life before death. Desperate to survive in a war that could yield another unfortunate fate, he joins the SSS in the battle against Angel, whose very mission is to destroy all inhabitants of this afterlife. As Otonashi struggles to recover his memory and learn more about this world, he finds that not all is as it had seemed.

(Source: Funimation)

tags.name: Afterlife
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the afterlife.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Amnesia
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) with memory loss.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Memory Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) who has had their memories altered.

tags.name: Boarding School
tags.description: Features characters attending a boarding school.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Angels
tags.description: Prominently features spiritual beings usually represented with wings and halos and believed to be attendants of God.

tags.name: Survival
tags.description: Centers around the struggle to live in spite of extreme obstacles.

tags.name: Found Family
tags.description: Features a group of characters with no biological relations that are united in a group providing social support.

tags.name: Politics
tags.description: Centers around politics, politicians, or government activities.

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: School Club
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a school club scene.

tags.name: Band
tags.description: Main cast is a group of musicians.

tags.name: Rock Music
tags.description: Centers on the musical style of rock, not to be applied to anime that use rock in its soundtrack.

tags.name: Baseball
tags.description: Centers around the sport of baseball.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Chuunibyou
tags.description: Prominently features a character with "Middle School 2nd Year Syndrome", who either acts like a know-it-all adult or falsely believes they have special powers.

tags.name: Drugs
tags.description: Prominently features the usage of drugs such as opioids, stimulants, hallucinogens etc.

node.description:
__Birthplace:__ Tokyo, Japan

[Official Website/Profile (SSP)](http://ssp-create.com/tadaaoi/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/tada_aoi) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCuAkxJn7ZlqVOLdiRQIeJVA) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/多田葵) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aoi_Tada)

Aoi Tada is a Japanese singer and former voice actress. She formerly belonged to Gekidan Himawari. Her most noted voice role is [Ed](https://anilist.co/character/16/) in [Cowboy Bebop](https://anilist.co/anime/1/). She also performed an insert song to the series, "Wo Qui Non Coin."

In March 2005, she signed on to Moon-Bunny Entertainment and began her singer-songwriting career. She has performed theme songs for shows such as [Gunslinger Girl: Il Teatrino](https://anilist.co/anime/3231/), [Angel Beats!](https://anilist.co/anime/6547/) and [Charlotte](https://anilist.co/anime/20997/). She is also affiliated with the group Veil. She is credited for her Veil-related songs as Veil ∞ Aoi.

As of 2005, she has retired from voice acting but is still active as a singer.

(Source: Wikipedia)

__Graduated:__ Chuukyou University (Department of Psychology)

__Introduction:__
Jun Maeda is a Japanese scriptwriter, lyricist, composer and music producer. He is known as one of the founding members of the software company Key, and he is the main composer and original creator for most of Key's visual novels. His most notable works are Kanon (Mai and Makoto routes), Air, Clannad, Angel Beats!, Tomoyo After, and Little Busters!. Maeda also worked on Summer Pockets, which he claimed "needed to make readers cry or it would mean the end for Key".

__Biography:__
Before forming Key, Maeda worked for the company Tactics where he had a hand in the creation of two games for that company: Moon and One: Kagayaku Kisetsu e.

[Official Website](https://lia-music.jp/) | [Twitter](https://x.com/Liabobo3) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/lia_vocalist/?hl=en)

She is affiliated with the group, Veil.  Sampling voice for Vocaloid, [IA](https://anilist.co/staff/124349/IA)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/995498317)

Interested in films and comics from his early childhood on. After graduating high school he went to Yoyogi Animation Gakuin and afterwards started working as animator for [Ajia-do](https://anilist.co/studio/30/). After becoming a freelancer for a short time, he joined Logistics where he worked in the software development section and was responsible for animation work and later developing tools for animation work in games. In 2002 he founded [Team Till Dawn](https://anilist.co/studio/6412/), which was also the beginning of his career as anime director.

His hobbies outside of work include bodybuilding, in which he has gone as far as to take part in competitions

John Ledford is an entrepreneur and leader in the North American anime industry. In 1992, he founded A.D. Vision (ADV), paving the way for other businesses and the exponential growth anime has had within North America. With ADV's success, Ledford turned his sights to making the imaginative world of anime even more accessible with Anime Network's founding, North America’s first cable TV network dedicated to anime. He later partnered with Kadokawa Publishing and began Newtype USA with translated Japanese content and exclusive U.S. material related to all things anime, manga, and model reviews. This endeavor expanded into ADV Manga, which obtained licensing and publishing rights for hundreds of Japanese manga and Korean manhwa.

In 2008, Ledford founded a new anime-focused company called Sentai Filmworks (Sentai). Since its founding, Sentai provides thousands of hours of content across traditional and digital platforms. Sentai’s dedication to bringing captivating stories, including acclaimed titles such as Grave of the Fireflies, Ninja Scroll, and High School of the Dead to audiences, is ongoing.

Ledford’s most recent success is with the 2017 founding of the streaming service HIDIVE. Since launching, HIDIVE is now available via a web browser, mobile devices, gaming platforms, and more. HIDIVE offers new simulcasts every season, an ever-growing collection of dubs, and exclusive titles. The service features DUBCAST SM editions, early access local-language dubs of simulcasts directly produced by HIDIVE, as early as two weeks after the original Japanese broadcast.

For nearly thirty years now, Ledford continues his goal to further the expansion of anime and the Japanese culture as a whole.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/iktd13_)

Na-Ga is a male Japanese artist who is employed as a graphic designer and illustrator for the company Key known for such famous visual novels as Kanon, Air, and Clannad among others. Prior to working for Key, he was employed by the visual novel company Pearl Soft. Na-Ga has been working for Key since the production of Air as one of the computer graphic artists, but was able to majorly contribute to character design in Key's sixth visual novel Little Busters! with Itaru Hinoue, along with the later released Little Busters! Ecstasy and Kud Wafter. For Key's ninth title Rewrite, Na-Ga contributed to the game's computer graphics.
Originating from [Gainax](https://anilist.co/studio/6/).

Was inspired to become an animator after having seen [Ninku](https://anilist.co/anime/912/).

[Website](http://www.lxixsxa.com/) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/lxixsxa/) | [Profile (Anison)](http://anison.info/data/person/29206.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/LiSA_OLiVE) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/xlisa_olivex/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/c/lisaSMEJ) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/lxixsxa.jp) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LiSA_(Japanese_musician,_born_1987)) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/LiSA)

LiSA is a Japanese singer, songwriter and lyricist from Seki, Gifu. LiSA started her own band while in high school to catch a growing wave of punk rock. In 2008, she moved to Tokyo in order to further her musical career. The name "LiSA" stands for "Love is Same All" or "LiVE is Smile Always."

She announced her marriage to voice actor and singer [Tatsuhisa Suzuki](https://anilist.co/staff/95735/Tatsuhisa-Suzuki) on January 22, 2020.

LiSA is a Japanese singer, songwriter and lyricist from Seki, Gifu. LiSA started her own band while in high school to catch a growing wave of punk rock. In 2008, she moved to Tokyo in order to further her musical career. The name "LiSA" stands for "Love is Same All" or "LiVE is Smile Always."

She announced her marriage to voice actor and singer [Tatsuhisa Suzuki](https://anilist.co/staff/95735/Tatsuhisa-Suzuki) on January 22, 2020.

__[Website](https://nakamuramarina.net/)__

__Birthplace:__ Miyazaki Prefecture, Japan

__Marina Nakmura__, better known by stage name Marina, is a Japanese vocalist. She is best known as Masami Iwasawa—the vocalist of the fictional group Girls Dead Monster in the anime Angel Beats!
[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/ste7en_foster/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/foster.steven)
[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/ste7en_foster/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/foster.steven)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ei_aoki)

Ei Aoki is a Japanese storyboard artist and director. He credits the anime Megazone 23 as his inspiration to have a career in animation. In 2013, he created the animation studio Troyca with Toshiyuki Nagano and Tomonobu Kato, which began animation production on its first work in the fall of 2014.
Also known as GirlDeMo. The vocals are performed by [Marina](https://anilist.co/character/24512/Masami-Iwasawa) (Masami Iwasawa) and [LiSA](https://anilist.co/staff/105561/LiSA) (Yui).
